type1.text: Did you clearly identify the key business problem or opportunity?
Did you ask clarifying questions to gather additional context and requirements?
Did you outline a structured approach for tackling the case study?
Did you propose specific data sources and analytical techniques?
Did you discuss potential challenges or limitations with the data or analysis?
Did you highlight the key insights and recommendations from your analysis?
Did you consider alternative perspectives or scenarios in your approach?
Did you demonstrate business acumen and understanding of industry dynamics?
Did you effectively communicate your thought process and rationale?
Did you tie your recommendations back to the overarching business objectives?

type2.text: How well did you structure your approach and break down the case into logical components?
options: Approach was disorganized without a clear structure
Used a basic framework inconsistently or incompletely
Followed a structured approach but some components were unclear or missing
Clearly broke down the case using a relevant framework or structure
Perfectly structured approach tailored to the unique case context

type2.text: How effectively did you apply data-driven analysis and quantitative reasoning?
options: Response did not incorporate any data analysis or quantitative elements
Mentioned data or numbers without meaningful analysis or insights
Displayed basic analytical skills but lacked depth or rigor
Showcased strong quantitative abilities and insight-driven analysis
Provided compelling data-driven insights through advanced analytical techniques

type2.text: How well did you handle ambiguity and make reasonable assumptions?
options: Did not acknowledge or address any ambiguous elements
Struggled with ambiguity and made unreasonable or unsupported assumptions
Made some reasonable assumptions but did not fully address ambiguity
Effectively navigated ambiguity by making and validating key assumptions
Clearly articulated a structured approach for thriving in ambiguous situations

type2.text: How strongly did your response demonstrate business judgment and strategic thinking?
options: Response was solely tactical without any strategic considerations
Mentioned high-level business objectives but did not connect well to recommendations
Displayed some business acumen and strategic thinking inconsistently
Clearly incorporated business context and strategic considerations
Provided highly strategic recommendations aligned with overarching business goals

type2.text: How persuasively did you communicate your insights and recommendations?
options: Response lacked clear insights or recommendations
Provided recommendations but did not effectively support or articulate them
Communicated insights and recommendations with some gaps or lack of clarity
Clearly articulated well-supported insights and actionable recommendations
Delivered a highly compelling and influential presentation of insights and recommendations
